content: Good game
Not as good as Duskwood but still brilliant! So gripping i went back and played it twice!!

This game isn't a choose your own adventure, it's a "choose your own responses" game. The choices are mostly responses to Sam describing his/her experiences. Most of the time he/she will just run off and do something and you'll have to wait. I can't even imagine playing the free version of this game with all the ads it must have with little to no payback. I really love text adventures but I've been disappointed with this one. I feel more like a bystander than a guest that is making decisions.
AWESOME GAME! i finished it super quickly unfortunately but I loved every minute of it. I wish I knew what happened to Sam though :(
I love it and I hope that thier are multiple endings to it. Thier where some werid ways things where worded but other then that it was awsome and hope that you make a part 2 two this game.

Absolutely amazing journey. Unbelievable considering that it comes from same authors as Duskwood that has quite annoying business model. I bought this version after I finished playthrough just to support developers.
Absolutely loved it. Didn't regret paying money. Amazing story, I can't wait to play it again while I wait for the next Duskwood episode.
Excellent, everbyte make another great game!

Meh. A very generic story with no flow at all. Very little decision-making unless you want to be a complete ar**hole and respond rudely with no reason. Sam never felt real and full-blooded as a character, so she never grew on me to the point of caring. Characters were introduced last-minute and they had no background, build-up or any purpose whatsoever. A very poor and basic attempt, unfortunately. Giving two stars as I have seen worse.
This game captured me right away. Sam is an intriguing character. It was fun but ended way to soon and to suddenly. I hate that I don't know what happened to Sam.
Brilliant, emotional game. Everyone needs to try it.
Really enjoyed this game. Sam was a loveable character. I have yet to try other routes and im hoping they lead to other ends and not just game overs.
Great story with simple interface
Very good game

I played the game free and then payed for it to support them i live the game one of the best games i have ever played on my phone that is text based i like they other text games as well it is super fun

I have never given 5* rateing.....but wow....just wow was soo amazing loved tje touching story only thing is at the very end i feel like i lost a real friendüòû R.I.P samüò≠ PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DO A PART 2 save sam let her get out and let it be known what is going on
Good game but too short
It is fun for what it is, but don't expect AAA storylines.
It was a great game but u should make a squeal

The writing is okay, if you've never read a book. It's not awful, just lacking in subtlety or complexity. Very much a 'this happened then that happened' story. Has nothing meaningful to say, and little in the way of characterisation. Reading time is around 40-50 minutes, maybe a little more with some skippable waiting around. The plotline is vaguely Season 1 of The Walking Dead TV show, but comes barreling to a close incredibly quickly leaving the actually (only one) good idea at the end lacking emotional impact. Would have liked to have seen that mechanic used more effectively, had the potential to be a real emotional gut punch had there been a more developed and deeper character to care about. Not sure if there's a sequel or similar from the same team, I'd buy it and hope they learned something from this one.

Innovative game. I rarely write for games but this one deserves it. I am an avid horror genre fan and watch everything from B rated movies to AA. The characters were well written and just the idea of the game being a text based game deserves a round of applause. Simple from a programmer's standpoint, and good character development. Please make one just like this with more choices, more consequences, more in depth development on situations and scenarios. Played free then bought it to support them
fun game sad its over.
The description is misleading, it's not a choose your own adventure, it's just a conversation. There were a lot of grammar mistakes. The story was just ok.
I enjoyed the game very much and i hope there will be a continuation
Didnt even play it! Portrait mode on a 12:2" device ?SERIOUSLY? REFUNDED STRAIGHT AWAY!.

It's innovative and gripping despite the relatively slow pace. The plot is moving too and I think Sam is really lovable. The choice to skip the waiting time by watching ads has made this a lot more enjoyable for those who would prefer not to wait. I really like this game and would like to support the company, so I bought it right after I completed the game. Thank you for creating it!
Kind of short in my opinion. I did both endings and i wish it was more complex, but it was a good game nonetheless. Good story, nice mechanics and a nice well rounded game.
a good well rounded story game with plenty of different ways to play.
honestly i shouldn't have waited so long to buy this game. loved how waiting for the texts made you want to play even more and made it seem more life like!

content: edit -extra star after app revision. Good game in there waiting to get out, but it's rather hobbled by the pacing - it seems like its mostly two or three inputs, a handful of responses spanning a minute give or take 30 seconds, then a long wait. Gas station sequence is a prime example of this - played right it could have been a tense, exciting encounter, but because of the start/stop..wait. pacing it was just too disconnected to be invested in it. A valiant effort but could do with another pass.
replyContent:
Hello Martin! We follwed your advice and made some changes to the application including the  "wait times" you mentioned. It is now possible to skip all wait times üëç It would be awesome if you could update your review üòä Kind regards,
Everbyte

Entertaining. My only complaint is the bad English. I'm not sure if this was translated from another language or the writer isn't fluent in English, but it's obvious English isn't the writer's first language. There were times I wasn't sure what exactly was going on because sentences were so strangely structured and common phrases/idioms were completely butchered. It took me out of the game and I wasn't able to fully enjoy because I was trying to decipher what Sam was saying/implying.
replyContent:
Hello Tiffani,
maybe english is not Sams first language?üßê

Jokes aside  - You're right, the game has been translated from German to English. We hired a professional for this but games are often not easy to translate - especially if they are dynamic. We're constantly working on the quality and we're glad you enjoyed the game nevertheless!
